snippet: Several states are reforming their criminal justice policies after finding that ever longer prison terms add huge costs to their budgets with little benefit to public safety.
abstract: Editorial expresses support for states that are reforming their criminal justice policies based on strong evidence that imprisoning nonviolent offenders for ever longer terms adds huge costs with little benefit to public safety.
lead_paragraph: Several states are reforming their criminal justice policies after finding that ever longer prison terms add huge costs to their budgets with little benefit to public safety.
